data.constraints: Each line with a phone number will have a character count of 14 or 10.
data.stubGenerator:
read x:int
loop x read number:string(20)
read y:int
loop y read check:string(20)
write answer
data.inputDescription:
The first list contains numbers that are registered on the woman's phone.
The next list contains numbers contacting the woman.

<<Line 1:>> [[x]] - Number of phone numbers to take in.
<<Next [[x]] lines:>> Formatted numbers on woman's phone.
<<Next line:>> [[y]] - Number of phone numbers to take in.
<<Next [[y]] lines:>> Unformatted numbers to compare
data.outputDescription:
Output [[y]] amount of lines.
Each line will have "{{You Know This Weirdo Stalker!}}" if the number is found in the phone
or "{{Weirdo Stalker!}}" if the contact is not present.

If instead of a number there's a name, that means the contact is already on your phone.

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

Help women keep weirdos out of their DMs! Take in a list of numbers on a woman's phone and compare them to the numbers that are contacting them.
Input
The first list contains numbers that are registered on the woman's phone.
The next list contains numbers contacting the woman.

Line 1: x - Number of phone numbers to take in.
Next x lines: Formatted numbers on woman's phone.
Next line: y - Number of phone numbers to take in.
Next y lines: Unformatted numbers to compare
Output
Output y amount of lines.
Each line will have "You Know This Weirdo Stalker!" if the number is found in the phone
or "Weirdo Stalker!" if the contact is not present.

If instead of a number there's a name, that means the contact is already on your phone.
Constraints
Each line with a phone number will have a character count of 14 or 10.
Example
Input
3
(429) 694-6493
(738) 388-5402
(593) 997-9629
4
4296946493
7383885402
Bob
1320900321
Output
You Know This Weirdo Stalker!
You Know This Weirdo Stalker!
You Know This Weirdo Stalker!
Weirdo Stalker!
